data.title: Rob Brydon MBE - Comedian and Awards Host
data.meta_description: Book Rob Brydon MBE to host your corporate awards ceremony. Rob is an award-winning comedian, broadcaster and comedy actor.
data.text:
Rob Brydon MBE is a Presenter, Comedy Actor and Stand-Up Comedian.

Born in Swansea, Brydon studied at the Welsh College of Music and Drama in Cardiff but left midway to become a radio presenter for BBC Wales.

Whilst at the BBC Rob Brydon joined the Bath-based improvisational comedy group More Fool Us, where he met Julia Davis with whom he would go on some years later to make the award-winning Human Remains.

Leaving Cardiff for London, Rob worked mostly as a voice artist on animations and commercials until his role as the traffic warden in Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels prompted him to make a short video of comic characters he had created.Â The video, Rob Brydon – An Extremely Unlucky Traffic Warden finished with Cardiff cabbie Keith Barret chatting cheerily to a camera fixed to the dashboard

In 2005, Brydon co-starred in Michael Winterbottomâs A Cock and Bull Story. His other films include Sean Conneryâs First Knight (1995); 24 Hour Party People (2002) and Mirror Mask.

As a writer/producer, his comedy series, Rob Brydonâs Annually Retentive started in 2006 on BBC3. He co-wrote and starred in the award-winningÂ Marion and Geoff, (BBC2); the second series was BAFTA nominated in 2004. His comedy talk show The Keith Barret Show was broadcast on (BBC2)

Rob starred in Kenneth Tynan: In Praise of Hardcore, played the lead in Murder in Mind on BBC1, was seen in BBC1âs costume Drama The Way We Live Now and BBC 2âs Cruise of the Gods.

Since 2007 Rob Brydon has played Bryn in the multi-award-winning BBC sitcom Gavin and Stacy.

Since 2009, Brydon has presented the BBC One comedy panel show Would I Lie to You? Rob has presented his own BBC Two late-night chat show called The Rob Brydon Show and in 2014, he hosted the Saturday-night game show The Guess List for BBC One.

Since 2010 Rob has appeared alongside Steve Coogan in Michael Winterbottomâs BBC2 sitcom The Trip.

On the corporate and conference circuit, Rob is a very entertaining After-Dinner Speaker and popular Awards Host.
